video.transcript:
Coach: As a Sales Manager, performance planning and measurement are essential to your success.

It allows you to see:
• Where you are now
• Where you are going
• How to get there
• Where your life insurance professionals are now
• Where your life insurance professionals are going, and
• How your life insurance professionals will get there.

You can also identify trends, patterns and any issues of underperformance.

Your key responsibility as a Sales Manager is to ensure that the overall plan for each quarter is in place and kept on track.

This should include key dates for:
• Regular reviews
• One-to-one meetings
• Unit meetings

You might also want to include training interventions and product launches.

As a Sales Manager, you also need to make sure every life insurance professional on your team has a plan. In order to communicate this and how it fits in with the unit’s overall plan, you need to hold one-to-one planning meetings.
